```{r, results="asis"}
# devtools::document()
pkgload::load_all()
options(tt_placement = "H")
x <- mtcars[1:4, 1:4]
```

# HTML

```{r, eval = FALSE}
devtools::document()
pkgload::load_all()
tt(x, output = "html") |> 
  # style_row(bg = "pink", fg = "blue", ht = "2cm", valign = "m", font = "monospace") |>
  style_column(1:2, bg = "pink") |>
  # cat()
  cat(file = "~/Downloads/trash.html")
```


# Width

Extendable columns:

```{r}
tt(x,
  tabularray_extendable = TRUE,
  tabularray_inner = "width=.7\\linewidth")
```

# Transform all entries

By default, all functions transform all cells. For example, calling `style_column()` without specifying column numbers will apply the transformation to all columns:

```{r}
tt(x) |>
  style_column(bg = "pink")
```

# Columns

```{r}
tt(x) |>
  style_column(j = 2:3, fg = "white", bg = "olive2", cmd="\\texttt")
```

# Rows

```{r}
tt(x) |>
  style_row(i = 2:3, fg = "blue6", bg = "pink", font="\\bfseries")
```

# Cells

## Style

```{r}
tt(x) |>
  style_column(j = 1, halign = "c") |>
  style_cell(i = 2:3, j = 1, fg = "red") |>
  style_cell(i = 4, j = 1, bg = "red")
```

## Spanning cells

```{r}
tt(x) |>
  style_cell(i = 2, j = 1, r = 3, c = 2, bg = "pink")
```
